member.name: T:Skyline.DataMiner.Scripting.NotifyProtocol
member.summary: This class defines a number of methods for the SLProtocol interface. Most extension methods just wrap a specific NotifyProtocol method call to improve readability.

remarks.para: Prior to DataMiner 10.1.1 (RN 27995), these methods are all defined as extension methods on the SLProtocol interface. However, from DataMiner 10.1.1 onwards, the interface itself has been extended with these methods, which should be used instead of the static methods defined in this class.

member.summary: Adds a row to the table.

The ID of the table parameter.
The primary key of the row.

In case the data contains null references, the corresponding cells will be cleared.
The FillArray method cannot be used together with the autoincrement column type.

item.description: This method acts as a wrapper for a NotifyProtocol type 193 call NT_FILL_ARRAY.
The FillArray method cannot be used together with the autoincrement column type.
This call is to be used with columns of type retrieved. In case other column types are present between the specified columns (e.g. columns of type "custom"), these other columns will be skipped.

The FillArray method overload with the SaveOption parameter accepts table rows instead of columns (whereas the other method overloads accept table columns). The implementation of this overload takes the provided list of rows and constructs an array where each element represents a column.
In case the data contains null references, the corresponding cells will be cleared.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Scripting.NotifyProtocol.GetKeys(Skyline.DataMiner.Scripting.SLProtocol,System.Int32,Skyline.DataMiner.Scripting.NotifyProtocol.KeyType)
member.summary: Gets the primary keys or display keys of the specified table.
member.param: Instance that implements .
The ID of the table parameter.
Specify KeyType.DisplayKey to retrieve the display keys.
member.returns: The primary keys or display keys of the rows present in the table.

remarks.para: Avoid using the GetKeys method to retrieve the primary keys (NotifyProtocol.KeyType.Index) for DataMiner versions prior to DataMiner 9.0. Up to DataMiner 9.0, the implementation to retrieve the primary keys is based on the SLElement process (a NotifyProtocol type 168 call "NT_GET_INDEXES" is executed, which retrieves both the primary keys and the display keys.).

From DataMiner version 9.0 onwards, the implementation of the GetKeys method has been updated, so that retrieving the primary keys no longer involves the SLElement process. (This now results in a NotifyProtocol type 397 call "NT_GET_KEYS_SLPROTOCOL"). However, note that obtaining the display keys(NotifyProtocol.KeyType.DisplayKey) is still based on SLElement(a NotifyProtocol type 168 call "NT_GET_INDEXES" call).

remarks.para: Avoid using the GetKeys method to retrieve the primary keys (NotifyProtocol.KeyType.Index) for DataMiner versions prior to DataMiner 9.0. Up to DataMiner 9.0, the implementation to retrieve the primary keys is based on the SLElement process (a NotifyProtocol type 168 call "NT_GET_INDEXES" is executed, which retrieves both the primary keys and the display keys.).

From DataMiner version 9.0 onwards, the implementation of the GetKeys method has been updated, so that retrieving the primary keys no longer involves the SLElement process. (This now results in a NotifyProtocol type 397 call "NT_GET_KEYS_SLPROTOCOL"). However, note that obtaining the display keys(NotifyProtocol.KeyType.DisplayKey) is still based on SLElement(a NotifyProtocol type 168 call "NT_GET_INDEXES" call).

The ID of the column parameter.
The value to match.

item.description: In order for this method to work, the column must either be a foreign key column or it must have the option indexColumn.
This method acts as a wrapper for a NotifyProtocol type 196 call (NT_GET_KEYS_FOR_INDEX).

From DataMiner 9.0.0 [CU14] (Main Release) and DataMiner 9.0.5 [CU1] (Feature Release) (RN 15333) onwards, this call does no longer perform a case sensitive lookup. In case a case-sensitive lookup is required, use the NT_GET_KEYS_FOR_INDEX_CASED notify type (411).

member.name: T:Skyline.DataMiner.Scripting.SLProtocol
member.summary: SLProtocol interface allowing communication with the SLProtocol process.

remarks.note: SLProtocol is an interface from DMA 10.0.1 onwards (RN 23787). In earlier DataMiner versions, it is a concrete class.
remarks.para: All methods are blocking, except for the method.

Many methods defined in this class also act as a wrapper for a specific , or method call. Using these methods is generally preferred over using the specific notify calls as this improves readability and type safety.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Scripting.SLProtocol.ExecuteScript(Skyline.DataMiner.Net.Messages.ExecuteScriptMessage)
member.summary: Executes the specified Automation script.
member.param: Information about the script to execute.
member.returns: Information about the execution of the Automation script.

remarks.para: The script will be executed by the user who is performing the QAction. It will return an , containing information about the execution of the script.
Using this overload of the ExecuteScript method is particularly useful when the script in question needs a dummy or protocol information to run.

examples.para: In the example above, note the use of the options "EXTENDED_ERROR_INFO" and "DEFER:TRUE".
The ErrorMessages property of ExecuteScriptResponseMessage can contain error strings from two stages of executing a script:

item.description: When something went wrong while the script was being loaded and prepared for execution.
Errors that occurred in the script.

examples.para: When you send an ExecuteScriptMessage, the script will by default be executed asynchronously. This means that the script will be scheduled, and a response message is returned with only the errors of stage 1. When you enable synchronous execution, the call will wait until the script is finished, and return the errors from the script (stage 2) as well.
You can enable this by adding the option string DEFER:FALSE' to the Options property of ExecuteScriptMessage.

You should also include the "EXTENDED_ERROR_INFO" option as this will make sure that the errors are returned in the response message. (Otherwise SLAutomation will throw an exception when the script fails and the errors are lost).
The HadError property will return true when the ErrorCode property has a code (int) lower than 0, indicating that something went wrong.
For another example that illustrates the execution of an Automation script with a custom entry point, refer to class.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Scripting.SLProtocol.ExecuteScript(System.String)
member.summary: Executes the Automation script with the specified name.
member.param: The name of the Automation script to execute.
member.returns: Information about the execution of the Automation script.

remarks.para: The script will be executed by the user who is performing the QAction. It will return an , containing information about the execution of the script.
If you execute a script using this method, it will be executed with all script execution settings set to the default values. If more control is needed, then use the overload.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Scripting.SLProtocol.FillArray(System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Object[]},Skyline.DataMiner.Scripting.NotifyProtocol.SaveOption)
member.summary: Sets the content of the table to the provided content.
member.param: The ID of the table parameter.
The rows of the table.
SaveOption.Full = unspecified primary keys are removed; SaveOption .Partial = rows with unspecified primary keys are preserved.

item.description: Prior to DataMiner 10.1.1 (RN 27995), this method was defined as an SLProtocol extension method in the NotifyProtocol class.
This method acts as a wrapper for a NotifyProtocol type 193 NT_FILL_ARRAY call.

The FillArray method overload with the saveOption parameter accepts table rows instead of columns (whereas the other method overloads accept table columns). The implementation of this overload takes the provided list of rows and constructs an array where each element represents a column.
In case the data contains null references, the corresponding cells will be cleared.
The FillArray method cannot be used together with the "autoincrement" column type.
This call is to be used with columns of type "retrieved". In case other column types are present between the specified columns (e.g. columns of type "custom"), these other columns will be skipped.

When a GetParameter call is executed for a parameter that does not exist in the protocol, is returned and the following message will be logged NT_GET_PARAMETER for [parameterID] failed. 0x80040239.

When calling this method on a numeric standalone parameter(i.e.a parameter having RawType set to either numeric text, signed number or unsigned number) that is not initialized, 0 will be returned.To determine whether a standalone parameter is uninitialized, the method should be used.

item.description: This is a wrapper method for the NotifyProtocol type 85 NT_GET_PARAMETER_BY_NAME call.

When a GetParameter call is executed for a parameter name that does not exist in the protocol a null reference is returned and the following message will be logged NT_GET_PARAMETER_BY_NAME for [name] failed. 0x80040239.
In case there is both a read and write parameter with the specified name, the value of the write parameter will be returned.

When calling this method on a numeric parameter (i.e.a parameter having RawType set to either numeric text, signed number or unsigned number) that is not initialized, 0 will be returned.To determine whether a standalone parameter is uninitialized, the IsEmpty method should be used.

When calling this method on a numeric parameter(i.e.a parameter having RawType set to either numeric text, signed number or unsigned number) that is not initialized, 0 will be returned.To determine whether a standalone parameter is uninitialized, the method should be used.

item.description: This is a wrapper method for the NotifyProtocol type 84 NT_SET_PARAMETER_BY_NAME call.

In case there are both a read and write parameter with the specified name, the set will be performed on the write parameter.In case the read parameter needs to be set, use the SetReadParameterByName method instead.

In case multiple parameters need to be set, it is preferred to use a single SetParametersByName method call in order to reduce the inter-process communication between the SLScripting and SLProtocol processes.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.Scripting.SLProtocol.DataMinerID
member.summary: Gets the Agent ID of the element executing the QAction.

remarks.note: This is the ID of the Agent where the element was originally created, which can be different from the ID of the Agent that is currently hosting the element because of DELT. (DELT stands for DataMiner Element Location Transparency. It is the feature that allows exporting and importing packages as well as migration of elements across Agents in a DataMiner System.)

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Scripting.SLProtocol.GetParameterIndex(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the value of a cell in the table specified by the 1-based row and column position.
member.param: The ID of the table parameter.
The 1-based position of the row.
The 1-based position of the column.
member.returns: The value of the cell.

item.description: This is a wrapper method for the NotifyProtocol type 122 NT_GET_PARAMETER_INDEX call.

When a GetParameterIndex call fails because the retrieved cell falls outside the bounds of the table, a null reference is returned and the following message is logged: NT_GET_PARAMETER_INDEX for [tableID]/[rowPosition]/[columnPosition] failed. 0x80040244.

When a GetParameterIndex call fails because the protocol does not contain a table parameter with the provided table ID, a null reference is returned and the following message is logged: NT_GET_PARAMETER_INDEX for [tableID]/[rowPosition]/[columnPosition] failed. 0x80040221.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Scripting.SLProtocol.SetParameterIndex(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Object,System.ValueType)
member.summary: Sets the value of a cell in a table, identified by its 1-based row and column position, with the specified value.
member.param: The ID of the table parameter.
The 1-based row position.
The 1-based column position.
The value to set.
Time stamp.
member.returns: Whether the cell value has changed. true indicates change; otherwise, false.

item.description: The primary key can never be updated.

In case multiple cells need to be set, it is preferred to use a single SetParametersIndex method call in order to reduce the inter-process communication between the SLScripting and SLProtocol processes.
This method acts as a wrapper for a NotifyProtocol type 121 call ("NT_PUT_PARAMETER_INDEX"). See [NT_PUT_PARAMETER_INDEX (121)](xref:NT_PUT_PARAMETER_INDEX).

member.returns: Whether the cell value has changed. true indicates change; otherwise, false.

item.description: The primary key can never be updated.

In case multiple cells need to be set, it is preferred to use a single SetParametersIndex method call in order to reduce the inter-process communication between the SLScripting and SLProtocol processes.
This method acts as a wrapper for a NotifyProtocol type 121 NT_PUT_PARAMETER_INDEX call.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Scripting.SLProtocol.SetParametersIndex(System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Object[],System.DateTime[])
member.summary: Sets the value of cells in tables, identified by their 1-based row and column position, with the specified values.
member.param: The IDs of the table parameters.
The 1-based positions of the rows.
The 1-based positions of the columns.
The values to set.
Time stamps.
member.returns: This method call can return an unsigned integer error code, e.g. when the size of the array does not match the size of the values array. Otherwise a uint[] is returned that has the same size as the array containing the HRESULT value.At each position, this array contains the result value as would be returned when performing a SetParameterIndex call on the individual cell.In case the value in the array is 262730 (0x0004024AL), this indicates the cell value changed.

item.description: The SetParametersIndex method cannot be used to update a single cell. In case a single cell must be updated, use the SetParameterIndex method instead. In cases where you dynamically set a number of cells, make sure to check the number of cells that will need to be updated. In case multiple cells need to be updated, use the SetParametersIndex method. If a single cell needs to be updated use the SetParameterIndex method.

This method should only be used in case multiple distinct cells need to be set(e.g., cells in different tables). When appropriate, use the SetRow, FillArray, FillArrayNoDelete, NotifyProtocol type 220 call, etc.to set multiple cells belonging to the same row, column or table, respectively.
This method acts as a wrapper for a NotifyProtocol type 121 NT_PUT_PARAMETER_INDEX call.
Feature introduced in DataMiner version 8.0.3.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Scripting.SLProtocol.SetRow(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Object,System.ValueType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the data of the specified row to the specified values.
member.param: The ID of the table parameter.
The 0-based index of the row.
The row data.
Time stamp.
When set to true, protocol.Clear and protocol.Leave can be used as cell values, which will clear or preserve the cell content, respectively.
member.returns: Array with value 0 (No Change) or 1(Change) to indicate the change state of the cell in the row.

item.description: This is a wrapper method for a NotifyProtocol type 225 (NT_SET_ROW) call.
The length of the rowData array must not be larger than the number of columns defined in the table.
The length of the rowData array may, however, be smaller than the number of columns defined in the table. In case there are fewer values than columns, then no update is done for the missing columns.
A null reference as cell value will preserve the value of the cell.

This is used with the SetRow method where the enableCellActions parameter has been set to true and NotifyDataMiner types 193 ([NT_FILL_ARRAY](xref:NT_FILL_ARRAY)) and 194 ([NT_FILL_ARRAY_NO_DELETE](xref:NT_FILL_ARRAY_NO_DELETE)) with the Clear and Leave flag enabled.

member.remarks:
This property is used with the SetRow method for example.
This is used with the SetRow method where the enableCellActions parameter has been set to true and NotifyDataMiner types 193 ([NT_FILL_ARRAY](xref:NT_FILL_ARRAY)) and 194 ([NT_FILL_ARRAY_NO_DELETE](xref:NT_FILL_ARRAY_NO_DELETE)) with the Clear and Leave flag enabled.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Scripting.SLProtocol.OldRow
member.summary: Gets information about the previous cell values before the row was updated.

returns.para: Information about the previous cell values in the row.
The return value is an object array where each element is an array containing information about the previous cell value.This array is organized as follows:

item.description: cellDetails[0]: Cell value
cellDetails[1]: Timestamp
cellDetails[2]: User
cellDetails[3]: Display string
cellDetails[4]: Display state
cellDetails[5]: ms
cellDetails[6]: TBD
This method can only be used in QActions that have the attribute row set to true and the preserve state option is enabled for this table.
If this method is used in a QAction for which the group option is specified, the method will instead return the values retrieved by the group that triggered the QAction. See group.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Scripting.SLProtocol.NewRow
member.summary: Retrieves information about the updated cells in a row.

returns.para: Information about the updated cells in the row.

This will be an object array where each element is either a null reference(in case the cell was not updated) or an array containing information about an updated cell.The array containing information about the updated cell is organized as follows:

item.description: cellDetails[0]: Cell value
cellDetails[1]: Update timestamp
cellDetails[2]: User
cellDetails[3]: Display string
cellDetails[4]: Display state
cellDetails[5]: ms
cellDetails[6]: TBD

item.para: This method can only be used in QActions that have the attribute row set to true.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Scripting.SLProtocol.SendToDisplay(System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32[])
member.summary: Makes the SLElement process update the specified parameter.
member.param: The ID of the parameter to update.
The 1-based inputs.
The 1-based outputs.
member.returns: HRESULT value. A value of 0 (S_OK) indicates the set succeeded.

item.description: This is a wrapper method for the NotifyProtocol type 123 NT_NOTIFY_DISPLAY call.
When SendToDisplay(int parameterID) is used on a matrix, this will update the entire matrix. This is also the case when input is set to 0 or -1 and output to 0 or -1.
It is advised to use one of the overloads providing the input(s) and output(s) when possible(i.e.when it is known which crosspoints have been updated) to reduce the load.
The overloads accepting one or multiple input and output indices were introduced in DataMiner version 9.0.0 (RN 12434, RN 12487).

item.para: In case of a 2x10 matrix, for example, the coordinates of the top-left crosspoint are iX=1/iY=1, and the coordinates of the bottom-right crosspoint are iX = 2 / iY = 10.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Scripting.SLProtocol.CheckTrigger(System.Int32)
member.summary: Triggers the trigger with the specified ID.
member.param: The ID of the trigger to be executed.
member.returns: HRESULT value. A value of 0 (S_OK) indicates the set succeeded.

item.description: This is a wrapper method for the NotifyProtocol type 134 (NT_CHECK_TRIGGER) call.

If a trigger defines when a trigger should trigger (using the On and Time tags) and the CheckTrigger method is called on this trigger, then the trigger will be invoked regardless of the values specified for the On and Time tags, except when On is set to "parameter" and Time is set to either "timeout" or "timeout after retries".

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Scripting.SLProtocol.GetConnectivityInterface(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves the specified DCF interface.
member.param: The DataMiner Agent ID of the element.
The element ID of the element.
The name of the interface.
true if the name specified in is the custom interface name; otherwise, false.
true to include interfaces of DVE children; otherwise, false.
member.returns: The specified interface or in case the interface was not found.

item.description: Feature introduced in DataMiner 8.5.8 (RN 10066).

The SLProtocol.GetConnectivityInterface method (Int32, Int32, string, Boolean, Boolean) retrieves all connectivity interfaces for the specified element (including interfaces of DVE children if exported is true) and then returns the connectivity interface with the specified name (if present). Therefore, if you need to request multiple interfaces, it can be more performant to request all interfaces using a GetConnectivityInterfaces call and extract the desired interfaces from the returned dictionary.

The SLProtocol.GetConnectivityInterface method (Int32, Int32, string, Boolean, Boolean) retrieves all connectivity interfaces for the specified element (including interfaces of DVE children if exported is true) and then returns the connectivity interface with the specified name (if present). The SLProtocol.GetConnectivityConnection method (Int32, Int32, string, Boolean) retrieves all connectivity connections for the specified element and then returns the connectivity connection with the specified name (if present). member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Scripting.SLProtocol.ShowInformationMessage(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Shows a message to the user in a pop-up window.
member.param: The message to be displayed.
The caption that will be displayed in the title bar of the pop-up window.

remarks.para: This only works in QActions that are directly triggered from a client with user interaction.

item.description: Write parameter that triggers a QAction
Context menu

remarks.para: Example scenarios that are not supported:

item.description: Protocol.SetParameter or Protocol.CheckTrigger that starts a new QAction
After Startup QAction
A read parameter that was set using setter=true

remarks.para: The message will only be shown to the client triggering the QAction (even when there are multiple Cube sessions open on the same client and all are using the same credentials, the message will only be shown on the intended client).
